  âº Read 1 file (ctrl+o to expand)                                          
                                                                            
  âº Write(IMPROVEMENT_PLAN.md)                                              
  âŽ¿ Â Wrote 231 lines to IMPROVEMENT_PLAN.md                                 
  1 # Rootly MCP Server Improvement Plan                                    
  2                                                                         
  3 ## What We're Doing                                                     
  4                                                                         
  5 We're improving your Rootly MCP server in 6 phases over 6-8 weeks       
  . The focus is on **security, code quality, testing, and MCP best         
  practices** - with **zero breaking changes** for existing users.          
  6                                                                         
  7 ---                                                                     
  8                                                                         
  9 ## The 6 Stages                                                         
  â€¦ +221 lines (ctrl+o to expand)                                           
                                                                            
  âº Perfect! I've saved the improvement plan to IMPROVEMENT_PLAN.md in      
  your                                                                      
  repository. Now let me exit plan mode and present this for your review.   
  âŽ¿ Â User rejected Claude's plan:                                           
  â•­â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€      
  â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â•®                                                                   
  â”‚ Rootly MCP Server Improvement Plan                                      
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ What We're Doing                                                        
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ We're improving your Rootly MCP server in 6 phases over 6-8 weeks.      
  The  â”‚                                                                    
  â”‚ focus is on security, code quality, testing, and MCP best               
  practices -   â”‚                                                           
  â”‚ with zero breaking changes for existing users.                          
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ ---                                                                     
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ The 6 Stages                                                            
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Stage 1: Fix Critical Security Issues (1 week)                          
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ What's wrong:                                                           
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Your API tokens are being logged (even partially) which is a          
  security â”‚                                                                
  â”‚ risk                                                                    
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Error messages contain full stack traces that expose internal         
  file    â”‚                                                                 
  â”‚ paths and implementation details                                        
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - No validation that URLs and tokens are properly formatted before      
  usingâ”‚                                                                    
  â”‚  them                                                                   
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ What we'll do:                                                          
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Remove all token logging - just say "token configured" instead        
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Strip stack traces from error responses (log them server-side         
  only)   â”‚                                                                 
  â”‚ - Validate tokens and URLs before using them                            
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Add timeout to all network requests                                   
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Files affected: __main__.py, client.py, server.py, and create new       
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ security.py                                                             
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Why this matters: These are high-severity security vulnerabilities      
  that â”‚                                                                    
  â”‚ could expose sensitive data.                                            
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ ---                                                                     
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Stage 2: Improve Error Handling (1 week)                                
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ What's wrong:                                                           
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - The code catches all exceptions with generic except Exception         
  (14     â”‚                                                                 
  â”‚ times!)                                                                 
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - You can't tell what actually went wrong (timeout? auth failure?       
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ network issue?)                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Some errors are silently ignored                                      
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ What we'll do:                                                          
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Replace broad exception catching with specific exception types        
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Create custom exception classes (RootlyAuthenticationError,           
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ RootlyNetworkError, etc.)                                               
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Make error messages consistent and helpful                            
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Add a decorator to handle errors automatically                        
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Why this matters: Better error handling means easier debugging and      
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ better error messages for users.                                        
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ ---                                                                     
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Stage 3: Simplify Complex Code (2 weeks)                                
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ What's wrong:                                                           
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Some functions are massive: get_oncall_shift_metrics() is 313         
  lines!  â”‚                                                                 
  â”‚ - Same code patterns repeated 3-4 times throughout                      
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Hard to understand, test, and maintain                                
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ What we'll do:                                                          
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Break large functions into smaller, focused functions (max 50         
  lines   â”‚                                                                 
  â”‚ each)                                                                   
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Extract duplicate code into reusable helpers                          
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Replace magic numbers with named constants                            
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Split code into logical modules (pagination, metrics,                 
  formatters)     â”‚                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Example:                                                                
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - get_oncall_shift_metrics() (313 lines) â†’ 6 smaller functions          
  (~50     â”‚                                                                
  â”‚ lines each)                                                             
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - search_incidents() (103 lines) â†’ 3 smaller functions (~30 lines       
  each) â”‚                                                                   
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Why this matters: Simpler code is easier to understand, test, and       
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ modify. Less likely to have bugs.                                       
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ ---                                                                     
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Stage 4: Add Comprehensive Tests (1 week)                               
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ What's wrong:                                                           
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Overall test coverage is only ~50%                                    
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Critical files have 0% test coverage:                                 
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚   - client.py (handles all API requests) - 0 tests                      
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚   - __main__.py (entry point) - 0 tests                                 
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚   - Data processing functions - 0 tests                                 
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Custom tools only 30% tested                                          
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ What we'll do:                                                          
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Add 200+ new tests                                                    
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Get overall coverage to >80% (>90% for critical paths)                
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Add integration tests for complete workflows                          
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Add performance benchmarks                                            
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Why this matters: Tests catch bugs before they reach production         
  and makeâ”‚                                                                 
  â”‚  refactoring safer.                                                     
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ ---                                                                     
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Stage 5: MCP Protocol Best Practices (1 week)                           
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ What's wrong:                                                           
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Tools don't declare their output format (no schemas)                  
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Can't cancel long-running operations                                  
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - No prompt definitions (server is tool-only)                           
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Missing pagination metadata                                           
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ What we'll do:                                                          
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Add typed output schemas to all tools                                 
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Implement request cancellation                                        
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Add 5 useful prompts (incident triage, on-call handoff,               
  postmortem,   â”‚                                                           
  â”‚ etc.)                                                                   
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Add pagination metadata to responses                                  
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Why this matters: Better MCP compliance means better integration        
  with   â”‚                                                                  
  â”‚ Claude and other MCP clients.                                           
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ ---                                                                     
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Stage 6: Polish & Document (2 weeks)                                    
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ What we'll do:                                                          
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Run automated code formatters (black, ruff, isort)                    
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Add comprehensive documentation:                                      
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚   - Architecture overview                                               
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚   - Security guidelines                                                 
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚   - Development guide                                                   
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚   - Complete API reference                                              
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Add performance benchmarks                                            
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Add detailed inline documentation                                     
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Why this matters: Good documentation makes the codebase accessible      
  to   â”‚                                                                    
  â”‚ other developers.                                                       
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ ---                                                                     
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Key Results                                                             
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ After all 6 stages:                                                     
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Security:                                                               
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - âœ… Zero high/critical vulnerabilities                                 
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - âœ… No sensitive data in logs or errors                                
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - âœ… All inputs validated                                               
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Code Quality:                                                           
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - âœ… All functions under 50 lines                                       
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - âœ… Code complexity reduced by >50%                                    
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - âœ… No duplicate code                                                  
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Testing:                                                                
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - âœ… >80% test coverage overall                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - âœ… >90% coverage for critical security/business logic                 
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - âœ… Tests run in under 5 minutes                                       
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ MCP Compliance:                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - âœ… All tools have output schemas                                      
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - âœ… Request cancellation supported                                     
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - âœ… Prompt definitions available                                       
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ No Breaking Changes:                                                    
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - âœ… Existing API unchanged                                             
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - âœ… Backward compatible                                                
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - âœ… No migration required                                              
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ ---                                                                     
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Tradeoffs & Decisions                                                   
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ 1. Code Clarity vs Performance                                          
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Decision: Prioritize code clarity                                       
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Why: The server is I/O bound (waiting on API calls), not CPU            
  bound.     â”‚                                                              
  â”‚ Clear code is more valuable than micro-optimizations that would         
  save <5%â”‚                                                                 
  â”‚  of runtime.                                                            
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ 2. Comprehensive Fixes vs Quick Wins                                    
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Decision: Do it right, do it once                                       
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Why: Quick fixes create technical debt. Taking 6-8 weeks now            
  prevents   â”‚                                                              
  â”‚ years of maintenance headaches.                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ 3. Test Coverage Goals                                                  
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Decision: 80% overall, 90% for critical paths                           
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Why: 100% coverage has diminishing returns. Focus on high-risk          
  areas    â”‚                                                                
  â”‚ gives best ROI.                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ 4. Breaking Changes                                                     
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Decision: Zero breaking changes                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Why: Existing users shouldn't need to change their code. All            
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ improvements are backward compatible.                                   
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ 5. Code Organization                                                    
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Decision: Split into multiple focused files                             
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Why: Better testability and maintainability. Slight increase in         
  imports â”‚                                                                 
  â”‚ is worth it.                                                            
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ ---                                                                     
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ What Could Go Wrong                                                     
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Risk 1: Refactoring Breaks Things                                       
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ How we'll prevent it:                                                   
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Add comprehensive tests BEFORE refactoring                            
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Change one function at a time                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Keep old code until new code is verified                              
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Use feature flags for new implementations                             
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Risk 2: Error Handling Changes Behavior                                 
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ How we'll prevent it:                                                   
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Document all changes                                                  
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Test all error scenarios before and after                             
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Maintain backward compatible error response formats                   
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Risk 3: MCP Changes Break Clients                                       
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ How we'll prevent it:                                                   
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Make all protocol enhancements backward compatible                    
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Version schemas and prompts                                           
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Test with multiple client versions                                    
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ ---                                                                     
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Timeline                                                                
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Week 1:    â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ Stage 1: Critical Security Fixes                    
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Week 2:    â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ Stage 2: Error Handling                             
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Week 3-4:  â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ Stage 3: Code Simplification                
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Week 5:    â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ Stage 4: Comprehensive Tests                        
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Week 6:    â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ Stage 5: MCP Compliance                             
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Week 7-8:  â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ Stage 6: Polish & Documentation             
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Total: 6-8 weeks                                                        
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Deployment Strategy:                                                    
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Weeks 1-2: Deploy security + error handling together                  
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Week 4: Deploy refactored code                                        
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ - Week 8: Deploy final improvements                                     
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Between each deployment: monitor for 1 week, verify no issues           
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ ---                                                                     
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Bottom Line                                                             
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Time: 6-8 weeks                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Effort: 1-2 full-time developers                                        
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Risk: Medium (but mitigated with careful staging)                       
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Breaking Changes: None                                                  
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ Value: Secure, maintainable, well-tested MCP server that follows        
  best   â”‚                                                                  
  â”‚ practices                                                               
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ The plan is comprehensive but practical. Each stage delivers value      
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚ independently, so you could stop after any stage if needed.             
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚                                                                         
  â”‚

  âº Excellent! I found the mcp-openai server. Here's how to install it:     
                                                                            
  Installation Steps                                                        
                                                                            
  1. Check Node.js version (need 18+):                                      
  node --version                                                            
                                                                            
  2. Add to Claude Desktop config at ~/Library/Application                  
  Support/Claude/claude_desktop_config.json:                                
  {                                                                         
  "mcpServers": {                                                           
  "mcp-openai": {                                                           
  "command": "npx",                                                         
  "args": ["-y", "@mzxrai/mcp-openai@latest"],                              
  "env": {                                                                  
  "OPENAI_API_KEY": "your-api-key-here"                                     
  }                                                                         
  }                                                                         
  }                                                                         
  }                                                                         
                                                                            
  3. Restart Claude Desktop                                                 
  4. Test it by asking me: "Can you ask gpt-4o to review the plan?"         
                                                                            
  Let me help you set this up:                                              
                                                                            
  âº Bash(node --version)

  for you.

  Support/Claude/claude_desktop_config.json - add this inside the           
  "mcpServers"                                                              
  section:                                                                  
                                                                            
  "mcp-openai": {                                                           
  "command": "npx",

  "env": {                                                                  
  "OPENAI_API_KEY": "sk-..."                                                
  }

  file (line                                                                
  17). This is one of the security issues we identified in the plan -       
  storing

  let's get                                                                 
  GPT-4o's review first.                                                    
                                                                            
  Which option do you prefer for the OpenAI API key?

  Goal: Get GPT-4o to review the improvement plan                           
                                                                            
  Options from simple to complex:                                           
                                                                            
  Option 1: You Manually Paste (30 seconds)                                 
                                                                            
  - Copy IMPROVEMENT_PLAN.md                                                
  - Paste into ChatGPT (chatgpt.com)                                        
  - Ask: "Review this technical plan for a Python MCP server. Focus on      
  tradeoffs, risks, and any missing considerations."                        
  - Bring feedback back here                                                
                                                                            
  Pros: No setup, instant, you control the conversation                     
  Cons: Manual step                                                         
                                                                            
  Option 2: MCP Server (5 minutes setup, then automated)                    
                                                                            
  - Add mcp-openai to config (what we were doing)                           
  - Restart Claude Desktop                                                  
  - I can then call GPT-4o directly from our conversation                   
                                                                            
  Pros: Automated, reusable for future reviews                              
  Cons: Requires API key in config, more complex                            
                                                                            
  Option 3: Claude Code Plugin (if one exists)

  GPT-4o.

  Recommended: Manual Copy/Paste (30 seconds)                               
  1. Open IMPROVEMENT_PLAN.md in your repo                                  
  2. Go to chatgpt.com                                                      
  3. Paste and ask: "Review this Python MCP server improvement plan.        
  Focus on:                                                                 
  security approach, testing strategy, tradeoffs, risks, and anything I     
  might                                                                     
  have missed."                                                             
  4. Bring the feedback back                                                
                                                                            
  Alternative: If you want GPT-4o integrated permanently                    
  - Install the mcp-openai server (5 min setup with your API key)           
  - Then I can call GPT-4o anytime from our conversations                   
                                                                            
  Which would you prefer? The manual approach is faster for this one-time   
  review, but the MCP server is better if you want ongoing GPT-4o access    
  from                                                                      
  Claude Code.

  - https://claudemarketplaces.com/                                         
  - https://paddo.dev/blog/claude-tools-plugin-marketplace/

âº I've fixed the config and it's ready to go! The mcp-openai server should load
  after you restart Claude Desktop.

  What I did:
  - Added missing comma on line 19 of your Claude config file
  - The mcp-openai server configuration looks correct

  Next step:
  Restart Claude Desktop (quit and reopen), then let me know when you're back.
  Once the MCP server loads, I'll be able to call GPT-4o to review the
  improvement plan.

  While you restart, I want to note one thing: your Rootly API token is visible
  in the config file (line 17). This is exactly one of the security issues we're
   planning to fix in Stage 1 of the improvement plan. After we get GPT-4o's
  review, we should consider moving these tokens to a more secure location like
  a password manager or environment variables.

  Let me know when you're back after the restart! ðŸš€

  the improvement plan and then try to use the OpenAI tools.

   it to get GPT-4o's review of the improvement plan.

  Looking at my available tools, I don't see any OpenAI-specific tools yet. This
   suggests the mcp-openai server might not have loaded successfully. Let me
  help troubleshoot:

  Troubleshooting steps:

  1. Check Claude Desktop logs - Can you check if there are any error messages?
  Logs are usually at:
    - ~/Library/Logs/Claude/mcp*.log or
    - Look in Claude Desktop's developer console (if available)
  2. Verify the configuration - Let me check your config file again:

âº Read 1 file (ctrl+o to expand)

âº Found the issue! The JSON structure is wrong. The mcp-openai and rootly
  configurations are outside the "mcpServers" object. They need to be inside it.
   Let me fix this:

âº Update(~/Library/Application Support/Claude/claude_desktop_config.json)

      26      }
      27  }

âº Perfect! I found and fixed the issue. The rootly and mcp-openai configurations
   were outside the "mcpServers" object. I've moved them inside where they
  belong.

  You need to restart Claude Desktop again for this fix to take effect.

  After you restart:
  1. The mcp-openai server should load properly
  2. I'll be able to see and use OpenAI tools
